24 #ifndef MATH_UTIL_H
25 #define MATH_UTIL_H 1
26 
27 #include <limits>
28 #include <cmath>
29 #include <algorithm> // min, max
30 
31 namespace emsr
32 {
33 
34  /**
35  * Return -1 if the integer argument is odd and +1 if it is even.
36  */
37  template<typename Tp, typename _IntTp>
38  inline constexpr Tp
39  parity(_IntTp k) noexcept
40  { return (k & 1) ? Tp{-1} : Tp{+1}; }
41 
42  /**
43  * A function to return the maximum of the absolute values of two numbers
44  * ... so we won't include everything.
45  * @param a The left hand side
46  * @param b The right hand side
47  */
48  template<typename Tp>
49  inline constexpr Tp
50  fp_max_abs(Tp a, Tp b) noexcept
51  {
52  if (std::isnan(a) || std::isnan(b))
53  return std::numeric_limits<Tp>::quiet_NaN();
54  else
55  {
56  const auto aa = std::abs(a);
57  const auto bb = std::abs(b);
58  return std::max(aa, bb);
59  }
60  }
61 
62  /**
63  * A function to reliably compare two floating point numbers.
64  *
65  * @param a The left hand side
66  * @param b The right hand side
67  * @param mul The multiplier for numeric epsilon for comparison
68  * @return @c true if a and b are equal to zero
69  * or differ only by @f$ max(a,b) * mul * epsilon @f$
70  */
71  template<typename Tp>
72  inline constexpr bool
73  fp_is_equal(Tp a, Tp b, Tp mul = Tp{1}) noexcept
74  {
75  if (std::isnan(a) || std::isnan(b) || std::isnan(mul))
76  return false;
77  else
78  {
79  const auto _S_tol = mul * std::numeric_limits<Tp>::epsilon();
80  bool retval = true;
81  if ((a != Tp{0}) || (b != Tp{0}))
82  // Looks mean, but is necessary that the next line has sense.
83  retval = (std::abs(a - b) < fp_max_abs(a, b) * _S_tol);
84  return retval;
85  }
86  }
87 
88  /**
89  * A function to reliably compare a floating point number with zero.
90  *
91  * @param a The floating point number
92  * @param mul The multiplier for numeric epsilon for comparison
93  * @return @c true if a and b are equal to zero
94  * or differ only by @f$ max(a,b) * mul * epsilon @f$
95  */
96  template<typename Tp>
97  inline constexpr bool
98  fp_is_zero(Tp a, Tp mul = Tp{1}) noexcept
99  {
100  if (std::isnan(a) || std::isnan(mul))
101  return false;
102  else
103  {
104  const auto _S_tol = mul * std::numeric_limits<Tp>::epsilon();
105  if (a != Tp{0})
106  return (std::abs(a) < _S_tol);
107  else
108  return true;
109  }
110  }
111 
112  /**
113  * A struct returned by floating point integer queries.
114  */
115  struct fp_is_integer_t
116  {
117  // A flag indicating whether the floating point number is integralish.
118  bool fp_is_integral = false;
119 
120  // An integer related to the floating point integral value.
121  int value = 0;
122 
123  // Return is_integral in a boolean context.
124  constexpr operator bool() const noexcept
125  { return this->fp_is_integral; }
126 
127  // Return value.
128  constexpr int
129  operator()() const noexcept
130  { return this->value; }
131  };
132 
133  /**
134  * A function to reliably detect if a floating point number is an integer.
135  *
136  * @param a The floating point number
137  * @param mul The multiplier of machine epsilon for the tolerance
138  * @return @c true if a is an integer within mul * epsilon.
139  */
140  template<typename Tp>
141  inline constexpr fp_is_integer_t
142  fp_is_integer(Tp a, Tp mul = Tp{1}) noexcept
143  {
144  if (std::isnan(a) || std::isnan(mul))
145  return fp_is_integer_t{false, 0};
146  else
147  {
148  const auto n = static_cast<int>(std::nearbyint(a));
149  const auto eq = fp_is_equal(a, Tp(n), mul);
150  return fp_is_integer_t{eq, n};
151  }
152  }
153 
154  /**
155  * A function to reliably detect if a floating point number is a half-integer.
156  *
157  * @param a The floating point number
158  * @param mul The multiplier of machine epsilon for the tolerance
159  * @return @c true if 2a is an integer within mul * epsilon
160  * and the returned value is half the integer, int(a) / 2.
161  */
162  template<typename Tp>
163  inline constexpr fp_is_integer_t
164  fp_is_half_integer(Tp a, Tp mul = Tp{1}) noexcept
165  {
166  if (std::isnan(a) || std::isnan(mul))
167  return fp_is_integer_t{false, 0};
168  else
169  {
170  const auto n = static_cast<int>(std::nearbyint(Tp{2} * a));
171  const auto eq = fp_is_equal(Tp{2} * a, Tp(n), mul);
172  return fp_is_integer_t{eq, n / 2};
173  }
174  }
175 
176  /**
177  * A function to reliably detect if a floating point number is a
178  * half-odd-integer.
179  *
180  * @param a The floating point number
181  * @param mul The multiplier of machine epsilon for the tolerance
182  * @return @c true if 2a is an odd integer within mul * epsilon
183  * and the returned value is int(a - 1) / 2.
184  */
185  template<typename Tp>
186  inline constexpr fp_is_integer_t
187  fp_is_half_odd_integer(Tp a, Tp mul = Tp{1}) noexcept
188  {
189  if (std::isnan(a) || std::isnan(mul))
190  return fp_is_integer_t{false, 0};
191  else
192  {
193  const auto n = static_cast<int>(std::nearbyint(Tp{2} * a));
194  const bool halfodd = ((n & 1) == 1)
195  && fp_is_equal(Tp{2} * a, Tp(n), mul);
196  return fp_is_integer_t{halfodd, (n - 1) / 2};
197  }
198  }
199 
200  /**
201  * A function to reliably detect if a floating point number is an even integer.
202  *
203  * @param a The floating point number
204  * @param mul The multiplier of machine epsilon for the tolerance
205  * @return @c true if a is an even integer within mul * epsilon.
206  */
207  template<typename Tp>
208  inline constexpr fp_is_integer_t
209  fp_is_even_integer(Tp a, Tp mul = Tp{1}) noexcept
210  {
211  if (std::isnan(a) || std::isnan(mul))
212  return fp_is_integer_t{false, 0};
213  else
214  {
215  const auto integ = fp_is_integer(a, mul);
216  return fp_is_integer_t{integ && !(integ() & 1), integ()};
217  }
218  }
219 
220  /**
221  * A function to reliably detect if a floating point number is an odd integer.
222  *
223  * @param a The floating point number
224  * @param mul The multiplier of machine epsilon for the tolerance
225  * @return @c true if a is an odd integer within mul * epsilon.
226  */
227  template<typename Tp>
228  inline constexpr fp_is_integer_t
229  fp_is_odd_integer(Tp a, Tp mul = Tp{1}) noexcept
230  {
231  if (std::isnan(a) || std::isnan(mul))
232  return fp_is_integer_t{false, 0};
233  else
234  {
235  const auto integ = fp_is_integer(a, mul);
236  return fp_is_integer_t{integ && (integ() & 1), integ()};
237  }
238  }
239 
240 } // namespace emsr
241 
242 #endif // MATH_UTIL_H
